snippet: For years, the only way to get inside the Renaissance-era Palazzo Farnese  was to attend a prebooked tour, in French or Italian. But thanks to the popularity of a show there last spring, the palace decided to expand its options for visitors and offer...
abstract: For years, the only way to get inside the Renaissance-era Palazzo Farnese  was to attend a prebooked tour, in French or Italian. But thanks to the popularity of a show there last spring, the palace decided to expand its options for visitors and offer tours in English.

headline.main: Palazzo Farnese Now Offers English Tours
